Courses Offered:

Programs aligned with Australia's skilled shortage list and PR pathway!

CHC33021 - Certificate III in Individual Support (Ageing & Disability)

R&R Au Educational Consultancy Services, in partnership with GeSS Education, proudly introduces the first and only University Pathway in the Philippines offering in-country offshore training aligned with the Australian Qualifications Framework (AQF). Our comprehensive 6-month Aged Care training program includes an employment contract and Visa sponsorship (407/482) through our secure partner, an esteemed Australian aged care employment institution.

UNITS OF COMPETENCY:

•CHCCCS031: PROVIDE INDIVIDUALISED SUPPORT

• CHCCCS040: SUPPORT INDEPENDENCE AND WELLBEING

•CHCDIV001: WORK WITH DIVERSE PEOPLE

•CHCLEG001: WORK LEGALLY AND ETHICALLY

• HLTINF006: APPLY BASIC PRINCIPLES AND PRACTICES OF INFECTION PREVENTION AND CONTROL

• CHCCCS041: RECOGNISE HEALTHY BODY SYSTEMS

• HLTWHS002: FOLLOW SAFE WORK PRACTICES FOR DIRECT CLIENT CARE

• CHCAGE013: WORK EFFECTIVELY IN AGED CARE

• CHCPAL003: DELIVER CARE SERVICES USING A PALLIATIVE APPROACH

• CHCAGE011: PROVIDE SUPPORT TO PEOPLE LIVING WITH DEMENTIA

• CHCDIS011: CONTRIBUTE TO ONGOING SKILLS DEVELOPMENT USING A STRENGTHS-BASED APPROACH

• CHCDIS012: SUPPORT COMMUNITY PARTICIPATION AND SOCIAL INCLUSION

• CHCDIS020: WORK EFFECTIVELY IN DISABILITY SUPPORT

*THIS COURSE IS DELIVERED ON BEHALF OF CBC RTO CODE 0095.

SIT30622 Certificate III in Hospitality

is a nationally recognized qualification in Australia designed for individuals who want to develop the essential skills needed to work in the hospitality industry. This course provides hands-on training and theoretical knowledge to prepare students for roles in hotels, restaurants, cafés, bars, and other hospitality establishments.

UNITS OF COMPETENCY:

•SITHIND006: SOURCE AND USE INFORMATION ON THE HOSPITALITY INDUSTRY

•SITHIND008: WORK EFFECTIVELY IN HOSPITALITY SERVICE

•SITXCCS014: PROVIDE SERVICE TO CUSTOMERS

•SITXCOM007: SHOW SOCIAL AND CULTURAL SENSITIVITY

• SITXHRM007: COACH OTHERS IN JOB SKILLS

• CHCCCS041: RECOGNISE HEALTHY BODY SYSTEMS

•SITXWHS005: PARTICIPATE IN SAFE WORK PRACTICES

•SITHIND005: USE HYGIENIC PRACTICES FOR HOSPITALITY SERVICE

• SITHCCC025: PREPARE AND PRESENT SANDWICHES

•SITHCCC026: PACKAGE PREPARED FOODSTUFFS

•SITHCCC028: PREPARE APPETISERS AND SALADS

•SITHKOP009: CLEAN KITCHEN PREMISES AND EQUIPMENT

•SITHFAB025: PREPARE AND SERVE ESPRESSO COFFEE

•SITXFSA006: PARTICIPATE IN SAFE FOOD HANDLING PRACTICES

•SITHCCC032: PRODUCE COOK-CHILL AND COOK-FREEZE FOODS

•SITHCCC038 - PRODUCE AND SERVE FOOD FOR BUFFETS

*THIS COURSE IS DELIVERED ON BEHALF OF CBC RTO CODE 0095.

OBA Nursing Academy- 7 Week OBA Preparation Program

OBA Nursing Academy offers a comprehensive 7-week OBA Preparation Program, blending essential theoretical knowledge with practical simulations to ensure readiness for the Outcome-Based Assessment (OBA). The program is priced at $6,000 AUD, plus a $250 non-refundable administration fee. For international nurses aiming to practice in Australia, various visa options are available, including the Temporary Skill Shortage Visa (Subclass 482), Skilled Work Regional Visa (Subclass 491), Training Visa (Subclass 407), and pathways under the Designated Area Migration Agreement (DAMA).

Program Duration: 7 weeks

• Online Theoretical Training: 6 weeks with Australian Registered Nurse educators

• Face-to-Face Clinical Simulation: 1 intensive week preparing for the OSCE assessment

• Self-Directed Learning (SDL): 20 hours per week with practice question bookletsProgram Fees: $6,000 AUD + $250 non-refundable admin fee (Includes all online course materials, clinical simulations, and expert guidance)

Why Choose OBA Nursing Academy?

• Tailored Programs: Designed specifically for international nurses transitioning to Australian standards.

• Pathways to Employment: Direct links to Australian registration and employment opportunities.

• Industry Partnerships: Collaborations with recruitment providers and healthcare facilities for sponsorships.

• Cultural Support: Dedicated workshops and resources to help international students adapt to life in Australia.
